text: The Brazilian slender-legged tree frog (Osteocephalus subtilis) is a frog in the family Hylidae. It lives in Brazil and Colombia. Scientists think it may also live in Peru. Scientists saw this frog sitting on plants 1-2 m above the ground. This frog is brown in color with brown or red stripes sideways across its back. Its eyes are very large. There is a white spot above each eye. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Brazilian slender-legged tree frog
